intro: Phacelia crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved phacelia, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its large, broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its hairy stems and showy flowers. Phacelia crassifolia is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators and as a forage plant for livestock.
